title: Authors and Citation
text: Martin (2026). kyschooldata: Kentucky School Data. R package version 0.1.0, https://almartin82.github.io/kyschooldata.
code: @Manual{,   title = {kyschooldata: Kentucky School Data},   author = {Al Martin},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://almartin82.github.io/kyschooldata}, }

title: Kentucky School Data
text: Documentation | Getting Started Fetch analyze Kentucky public school enrollment data Kentucky Department Education (KDE).

what: What can you find with kyschooldata?
title: Kentucky School Data
text: 28 years enrollment data (1997-2024). 650,000 students today. 171 school districts. ten stories hiding numbers:

previous_headings: What can you find with kyschooldata?
title: Kentucky School Data
text: Jefferson County Public Schools (Louisville) serves 95,000 students, nearly 15% Kentucky’s entire enrollment. ’s larger next five districts combined.
code: library(kyschooldata) library(dplyr)  enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students)) %>%   select(district_name, n_students) %>%   head(10)

previous_headings: What can you find with kyschooldata?
title: Kentucky School Data
text: Kentucky lost 25,000 students since 2015. decline accelerated COVID hasn’t reversed.
code: enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2015:2024)  enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   select(end_year, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with kyschooldata?
title: Kentucky School Data
text: Appalachian coal counties lost half students since 2000. Pike County, 15,000 students, now 9,000.
code: appalachian <- c("Pike County", "Floyd County", "Letcher County", "Perry County")  fetch_enr_multi(2000:2024) %>%   filter(grepl(paste(appalachian, collapse = "|"), district_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   select(end_year, district_name, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with kyschooldata?
title: Kentucky School Data
text: Hispanic students went 2% 9% enrollment since 2000. Lexington, Louisville, central Kentucky drive growth.
code: enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "hispanic") %>%   select(end_year, n_students, pct)

previous_headings: What can you find with kyschooldata?
title: Kentucky School Data
text: Kentucky lost 20,000 students 2020 2022. Unlike states, Kentucky recovered.
code: enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment",          end_year %in% 2019:2024) %>%   select(end_year, n_students) %>%   mutate(change = n_students - lag(n_students))

previous_headings: What can you find with kyschooldata?
title: Kentucky School Data
text: Louisville shrinks, Fayette County (Lexington) grown 42,000 students. Kentucky’s two urban districts opposite trajectories.
code: enr %>%   filter(grepl("Fayette County|Jefferson County", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   select(end_year, district_name, n_students) %>%   tidyr::pivot_wider(names_from = district_name, values_from = n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with kyschooldata?
title: Kentucky School Data
text: Kentucky one highest rates economic disadvantage nation. eastern Kentucky districts, 90%+ students qualify.
code: enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "econ_disadv") %>%   select(n_students, pct)  # Highest rates enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "econ_disadv") %>%   arrange(desc(pct)) %>%   select(district_name, n_students, pct) %>%   head(10)

previous_headings: What can you find with kyschooldata?
title: Kentucky School Data
text: Kentucky remains one least diverse states. Louisville Lexington significant minority populations; rural districts 95%+ white.
code: enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian")) %>%   select(subgroup, n_students, pct) %>%   arrange(desc(pct))

previous_headings: What can you find with kyschooldata?
what: 9. Boone County is Northern Kentucky’s growth story
title: Kentucky School Data
text: Boone County Cincinnati suburbs added 5,000 students since 2010. ’s now third-largest district Kentucky.
code: enr %>%   filter(grepl("Boone County", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   select(end_year, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with kyschooldata?
what: 10. Independent districts are a Kentucky tradition
title: Kentucky School Data
text: Kentucky county-wide districts (like Jefferson County) independent city districts (like Bowling Green Independent). independent districts serve just 1,000 students maintain school boards.
code: enr_2024 %>%   filter(grepl("Independent", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   arrange(n_students) %>%   select(district_name, n_students) %>%   head(10)

title: Kentucky School Data
Kentucky School Data
code: library(kyschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Fetch one year enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Fetch multiple years enr_recent <- fetch_enr_multi(2020:2024)  # Fetch historical data enr_historical <- fetch_enr_multi(1997:2011)  # State totals enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  # District breakdown enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students)) %>%   select(district_name, n_students)  # Demographics by district enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic")) %>%   group_by(district_name, subgroup) %>%   summarize(n = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE))

title: Kentucky School Data
text: Note: 2025 data yet available KDE.

title: Kentucky School Data
text: Levels: State, district (171), school (~1,500) Demographics: White, Black, Hispanic, Asian, Native American, Pacific Islander, Multiracial Special populations: Economically Disadvantaged, LEP, Special Education Grade levels: Pre-K Grade 12 (2020+ )

title: Kentucky School Data
text: Kentucky uses hierarchical ID system: - District ID: 3 digits (e.g., 275 Jefferson County) - School ID: 6 digits (district + 3-digit school code)

title: Kentucky School Data
text: Kentucky Department Education: Open House SRC Data | Historical Data

Fetch Kentucky enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Downloads processes enrollment data Kentucky Department Education via School Report Card (SRC) datasets SAAR data.

title: Fetch Kentucky enrollment data — fetch_enr
Fetch Kentucky enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: end_year school year. Year end academic year - eg 2023-24 school year year '2024'. Valid values 1997-2024: 1997-2011: SAAR data (district-level ) 2012-2019: SRC Historical datasets 2020-2024: SRC Current format datasets Note: 2025 data yet available KDE Dec 2025. tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format subgroup column. FALSE, returns wide format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available. Set FALSE force re-download KDE.

title: Fetch Kentucky enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Data frame enrollment data. Wide format includes columns district_id, school_id, names, enrollment counts demographic/grade. Tidy format pivots counts subgroup grade_level columns.

title: Fetch Kentucky enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Get wide format enr_wide <- fetch_enr(2024, tidy = FALSE)  # Force fresh download (ignore cache) enr_fresh <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = FALSE)  # Filter to specific district jefferson_county <- enr_2024 %>%   dplyr::filter(district_id == "275")  # Jefferson County } # }

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: end_years Vector school year ends (e.g., c(2022, 2023, 2024)) tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Combined data frame enrollment data requested years

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 3 years of data enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2022:2024)  # Track enrollment trends enr_multi %>%   dplyr::filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   dplyr::select(end_year, n_students) } # }

title: Get the URL for KDE enrollment data — get_enrollment_urls
code: get_enrollment_urls(2024)  # KYRC24 format #> [1] "https://www.education.ky.gov/Open-House/data/HistoricalDatasets/KYRC24_OVW_Student_Enrollment.csv"   #> [2] "https://www.education.ky.gov/Open-House/data/HistoricalDatasets/KYRC24_OVW_Primary_Enrollment.csv"   #> [3] "https://www.education.ky.gov/Open-House/data/HistoricalDatasets/KYRC24_OVW_Secondary_Enrollment.csv" get_enrollment_urls(2023)  # primary/secondary format #> [1] "https://www.education.ky.gov/Open-House/data/HistoricalDatasets/primary_enrollment_2023.csv"   #> [2] "https://www.education.ky.gov/Open-House/data/HistoricalDatasets/secondary_enrollment_2023.csv" get_enrollment_urls(2005)  # SAAR format #> [1] "https://education.ky.gov/districts/enrol/Documents/1996-2019%20SAAR%20Summary%20ReportsADA.xlsx"

what: kyschooldata: Fetch and Process Kentucky School Data — kyschooldata-package
title: kyschooldata: Fetch and Process Kentucky School Data — kyschooldata-package
text: Downloads processes school data Kentucky Department Education (KDE). Provides functions fetching enrollment data School Report Card (SRC) datasets SAAR (Superintendent's Annual Attendance Report) data, transforming tidy format analysis.

title: kyschooldata: Fetch and Process Kentucky School Data — kyschooldata-package
text: fetch_enr Fetch enrollment data school year fetch_enr_multi Fetch enrollment data multiple years tidy_enr Transform wide data tidy (long) format id_enr_aggs Add aggregation level flags enr_grade_aggs Create grade-level aggregations get_available_years Show available data years

title: kyschooldata: Fetch and Process Kentucky School Data — kyschooldata-package
text: cache_status View cached data files clear_cache Remove cached data files

title: kyschooldata: Fetch and Process Kentucky School Data — kyschooldata-package
text: Kentucky uses hierarchical ID system: District IDs: 3 digits (e.g., 275 = Jefferson County) School IDs: 6 digits (3-digit district + 3-digit school)

title: kyschooldata: Fetch and Process Kentucky School Data — kyschooldata-package
text: Data sourced Kentucky Department Education: SRC: https://openhouse.education.ky.gov/Home/SRCData Open House: https://www.education.ky.gov/Open-House/data/Pages/default.aspx SAAR: https://www.education.ky.gov/districts/enrol/pages/historical-saar-data.aspx

title: kyschooldata: Fetch and Process Kentucky School Data — kyschooldata-package
text: Era 1 (1997-2011): SAAR Ethnic Membership Reports - district-level Era 2 (2012-2019): SRC Historical Datasets - school district level Era 3 (2020-2025): SRC Current Format - school district level grade data

title: kyschooldata: Fetch and Process Kentucky School Data — kyschooldata-package
